channel.title: Experimental & Ideation Teams on iGEM at Berkeley
channel.description: Recent content in Experimental & Ideation Teams on iGEM at Berkeley

item.title: Cell Gel
item.description: Project Leads: Jiahao (Robert) Yao, Ling Yin Conventionally, genetically-engineered E.

item.title: Cellyse
item.description: Project Leads: Jacob Rulison, Ella Ramamurthy Cellyse is focused on using genetic engineering techniques to improve sustainability within science.

item.title: Cheese Engineering
item.description: Project Leads: Rachelle Smith, Hanen Su Fungal spoilage of cheese can have major economic losses due to food safety issues, additional work to remove it, product losses and waste, and reduction of quality.

item.title: CheRMiT
item.description: Project Leads: Max Lee, Bryan Hsu The CheRMiT team is developing a pipeline for mining and processing chemical reactions from millions of papers published in scientific literature.

item.title: Clonebots Assembly
item.description: Project Leads: Milo Scola, Lukas Koller Our team is attempting to create a more efficient version of the BioBricks assembly method.

item.title: Clonebots Deletion
item.description: Project Leads: Peiwen Xiao, Kaitlyn Wang Generating efficient gene knockouts in bacteria is a crucial component of many synthetic biology projects.

item.title: Genomics
item.description: Project Leads: Lavanya Jain and Vibha Yellamraju Our Genomics team will have the opportunity to research and work on a novel problem of the team’s choice in genomics.

item.title: Hallucinating Scaffolds
item.description: Project Leads: Fenmiao Zhong, Ying-Li Su Hallucinating scaffolds team aims to design functional de novo proteins by taking active sites of an enzyme and hallucinating, i.

item.title: Peptide Design
item.description: Project Leads: Gean Hu, Shreya Ramesh The Peptide Design Teamâ€™s goal is to better understand how to use computational techniques to study and design proteins and peptides.

item.title: Protein Engineering
item.description: Project Leads: Isha Soni, Amad Jalil The directed evolution (DE) team is engineering a more thermostable form of the protein IscB-wRNA, an evolutionary precursor to Cas9 that has a range of biotechnological applications.
